wordpressPost.title: Meet Pantheon, WPCampus 2019 Sponsor
wordpressPost.excerpt: Pantheon is a website operations platform for Drupal and WordPress. We are so grateful to have this company as the doctoral sponsor for WPCampus 2019.
wordpressPost.content:
This post is part of a series featuring sponsors from the WPCampus 2019 conference. This event would not be possible without the support of these amazing organizations. Be sure to check out their services, and say hello to them in Portland.

Pantheon is a website operations platform for Drupal and WordPress, running more than 200,000 sites in the cloud and serving more than 10 billion pageviews a month.

Pantheon’s multitenant, container-based platform enables educational institutions to manage all of their websites from a single dashboard. Customers include Arizona State University, Cornell, Harvard, Yale, and Penn. For more information, visit pantheon.io/edu.

WPCampus 2019 takes place July 25-29, 2019, on the campus of Lewis and Clark College in Portland, Oregon. It’s three days filled with sessions, workshops, networking, and social eventsâ€”all focused on using WordPress in higher education.

Can’t make it to the event? Check out the 2019 watch page to livestream sessions.
